Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Message() [1/2]

discpp::Message::Message ( const Snowflake &  channel_id,
const Snowflake &  id,
bool  can_request = false 
)

Constructs a discpp::Message object from an id.

If you set can_request to true, and the message is not found in cache, then we will request the message from the REST API. But if its not true, and its not found, an exception will be thrown of DiscordObjectNotFound.

Parameters
[in]channel_idThe channel_id of the message.
[in]idThe id of the message.
[in]can_requestWhether or not the library can request the message from the REST API.
Returns
discpp::Message, this is a constructor.

◆ GetReactorsOfEmoji() [1/2]

std::unordered_map< discpp::Snowflake, discpp::User > discpp::Message::GetReactorsOfEmoji ( const discpp::Emoji &  emoji,
const discpp::User &  user,
const GetReactionsMethod &  method 
)

Get reactors of a specific emoji of the specific method.

You can use std::unordered_map::find to check if a user is contained in it with the users id.

std::unordered_map<discpp::Snowflake, discpp::User> reactors = message.GetReactorOfEmoji(emoji, 50, reaction_method);
Parameters
[in]emojiThe emoji to get reactors of.
[in]amountThe amount of users to get.
[in]methodThe method the users reacted by.
Returns
std::vector<discpp::User>

◆ GetReactorsOfEmoji() [2/2]

std::unordered_map< discpp::Snowflake, discpp::User > discpp::Message::GetReactorsOfEmoji ( const discpp::Emoji &  emoji,
const int &  amount 
)

Get reactors of a specific emoji.

You can use std::unordered_map::find to check if a user is contained in it with the users id.

std::unordered_map<discpp::Snowflake, discpp::User> reactors = message.GetReactorOfEmoji(emoji, 50);
Parameters
[in]emojiThe emoji to get reactors of.
[in]amountThe amount of users to get.
Returns
std::vector<discpp::User>
